segment.source: Choose the right Microsoft Intune policy to use - deleted
segment.target: Choose the right Microsoft Intune policy to use - deleted

segment.source: Choose the right Microsoft Intune policy to use - deleted
segment.target: Choose the right Microsoft Intune policy to use - deleted

segment.source: policies are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.
segment.target: policies are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.

segment.source: You create policies using templates that contain recommended or customized settings, and then deploy them to device or user groups.
segment.target: You create policies using templates that contain recommended or customized settings, and then deploy them to device or user groups.

segment.source: What policies are available?
segment.target: What policies are available?

segment.source: Use this list to help you decide which policy you need:
segment.target: Use this list to help you decide which policy you need:

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: Policy name
segment.target: Policy name

segment.source: Use when you want to
segment.target: Use when you want to

segment.source: Custom Configuration (Android 4 and later, Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)
segment.target: Custom Configuration (Android 4 and later, Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)

segment.source: - Deploy OMA-URI settings, such as Wi-Fi settings that can be used to control device features.
segment.target: - Deploy OMA-URI settings, such as Wi-Fi settings that can be used to control device features.

segment.source: This is useful when the setting you need is not available in a configuration policy.
segment.target: This is useful when the setting you need is not available in a configuration policy.

segment.source: For details, see Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Email Profile (Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)
segment.target: Email Profile (Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)

segment.source: - Create, deploy and monitor Exchange ActiveSync email settings on managed devices.
segment.target: - Create, deploy and monitor Exchange ActiveSync email settings on managed devices.

segment.source: This lets users access corporate email on their personal devices without any required setup on their part.
segment.target: This lets users access corporate email on their personal devices without any required setup on their part.

segment.source: For details, see Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: General Configuration (Android 4 and later, Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)
segment.target: General Configuration (Android 4 and later, Samsung KNOX Standard 4.0 and later)

segment.source: - Configure mobile device security and functional settings.
segment.target: - Configure mobile device security and functional settings.

segment.source: - Specify apps that are compliant or noncompliant, and report when they are used.
segment.target: - Specify apps that are compliant or noncompliant, and report when they are used.

segment.source: - Configure kiosk mode that locks devices to allow only certain features to work, for example, allow the device to run only one app, or disable the volume buttons.
segment.target: - Configure kiosk mode that locks devices to allow only certain features to work, for example, allow the device to run only one app, or disable the volume buttons.

segment.source: For details, see Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: - Use this profile to create and deploy PFX settings for device certificate requests.
segment.target: - Use this profile to create and deploy PFX settings for device certificate requests.

segment.source: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: - Configure a Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol certificate which can be used with a trusted mobile device certificate to authenticate mobile devices to allow them to access network resources such as those configured by Wi-Fi and VPN profiles.
segment.target: - Configure a Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol certificate which can be used with a trusted mobile device certificate to authenticate mobile devices to allow them to access network resources such as those configured by Wi-Fi and VPN profiles.

segment.source: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: - Configure a trusted mobile device certificate which can be used to authenticate mobile devices to allow them to access network resources such as those configured by Wi-Fi and VPN profiles.
segment.target: - Configure a trusted mobile device certificate which can be used to authenticate mobile devices to allow them to access network resources such as those configured by Wi-Fi and VPN profiles.

segment.source: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: VPN Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: VPN Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: - Configure and deploy settings that give users secure access to your company network from their mobile device.
segment.target: - Configure and deploy settings that give users secure access to your company network from their mobile device.

segment.source: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to their work.
segment.target: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to their work.

segment.source: For details, see Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Wi-Fi Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: - Configure and deploy wireless network settings to users in your organization.
segment.target: - Configure and deploy wireless network settings to users in your organization.

segment.source: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to the wireless network.
segment.target: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to the wireless network.

segment.source: For details, see Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Mobile Application Management Policy (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Mobile Application Management Policy (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: Mobile Application Management Policy (iOS 7 and later)
segment.target: Mobile Application Management Policy (iOS 7 and later)

segment.source: - Modify the functionality of apps that you deploy to help bring them into line with your company compliance and security policies.
segment.target: - Modify the functionality of apps that you deploy to help bring them into line with your company compliance and security policies.

segment.source: For example, you can restrict cut, copy and paste operations within a restricted app, or configure an app to open all web links inside the managed browser.
segment.target: For example, you can restrict cut, copy and paste operations within a restricted app, or configure an app to open all web links inside the managed browser.

segment.source: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console
segment.target: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console

segment.source: Applications
segment.target: Applications

segment.source: Important: now features separate configuration policies for each device platform, and these policies contain the most up-to-date settings you can use.
segment.target: Important: now features separate configuration policies for each device platform, and these policies contain the most up-to-date settings you can use.

segment.source: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy and any existing deployments will still work, but you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible.
segment.target: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy and any existing deployments will still work, but you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible.

segment.source: For details, see Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You do not deploy conditional access policies to users and devices.
segment.target: You do not deploy conditional access policies to users and devices.

segment.source: Instead, you configure the required policy and it applies to all groups targeted in the policy.
segment.target: Instead, you configure the required policy and it applies to all groups targeted in the policy.

segment.source: Compliance policies
segment.target: Compliance policies

segment.source: - Define the level of compliance for devices and then report about devices that are noncompliant.
segment.target: - Define the level of compliance for devices and then report about devices that are noncompliant.

segment.source: These policies are used with conditional access to help evaluate devices that should be blocked from services.
segment.target: These policies are used with conditional access to help evaluate devices that should be blocked from services.

segment.source: For details, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.

segment.target: Policy name

segment.source: Microsoft Intune Agent Settings
segment.target: Microsoft Intune Agent Settings

segment.source: Configure the client on computers, including settings for:
segment.target: Configure the client on computers, including settings for:

segment.source: - Endpoint Protection
segment.target: - Endpoint Protection

segment.source: - Software updates
segment.target: - Software updates

segment.source: - Policy check schedule
segment.target: - Policy check schedule

segment.source: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.
segment.target: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.

segment.source: clients download new and updated policy according to the Update and application detection frequency setting, which defaults to 8 hours.
segment.target: clients download new and updated policy according to the Update and application detection frequency setting, which defaults to 8 hours.

segment.source: However, you can force a refresh of policy on computers at any time.
segment.target: However, you can force a refresh of policy on computers at any time.

segment.source: For details, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.

segment.target: Microsoft Intune Center Settings

segment.source: Configure details that appear in the Center on managed computers.
segment.target: Configure details that appear in the Center on managed computers.

segment.source: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.
segment.target: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.

segment.source: For details, see Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.
segment.target: For details, see Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.

segment.target: Windows Firewall Settings

segment.target: Configures Windows Firewall settings and exceptions for common network communications on computers, including:

segment.source: - BranchCache
segment.target: - BranchCache

segment.source: - Remote Assistance
segment.target: - Remote Assistance

segment.source: - Media sharing
segment.target: - Media sharing

segment.source: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.
segment.target: This type of policy can be deployed only to groups of devices.

segment.target: For details, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
